messages.content: Money money money
How many would you take if given the opportunity to take as many as possible?
Probably only one, actually
to trigger bolstering ghostflame

but I will say:
cute seal
most of the seals give you benefit the very next combat, while with this one you have to wait even longer for anything to pay off
I've probably only taken this once when I wasn't going for broken seal
I really need to redo the beta art to be digital art
think about seal rewards for a moment
card reward: +100% card rewards
potion reward: +200-300% potion rewards
upgrade reward: +500% or more upgrades density
meanwhile 10 gold is only like
60% more gold than usual
This is the seal I take the least, except maybe 6th seal
this is likely the worst seal out of all of them
every other seal at least doubles the amount of [reward] you have (twice the card rewards, many more upgrades, many more potions)
while 10 gold is less than the amount you get from a regular combat
and if you factor in other ways of gaining gold this seal turns out to be pretty bad

this is like the only not broken seal card and its still alright. You typically can get between 50 to 100 gold from this card before converting it into a completed seal later in the game. Its not as good as getting several potions, card rewards and upgrades but it still is something. I don't really want this without 6th seal in my deck though, since without being able to complete the seal this card can get in the way late game.
how much gold do you get from regular combats again? is it 11-20
to be in line with all the other seals this would need to be like 15 or 20g, but idk if hexaghost is in need of buffs considering their curent state
so yeah, the purpose of this one is mostly just the broken seal quest
standalone it's underwhelming
so 15 average

I think its fine for it to be underwhelming by its own. All 5 of the other seal cards are very good; I'd argue most of them are too good (5th seal is a better lesson learned and you can farm 5th seals with 6th sealed to get a completely upgraded deck)

ya 6th seal just gives you the broken seal and you don't even have to worry about losing your seal cards after you get the relic since you can get more of them in abundance
there's no risk. I don't think I've ever died going for broken seal once I had sixth
like I don't want to lose my 5th seal, but when I have 6th seal I can just replace that 5th seal with 2 more 5th seals.
thoughts?
I'd play a 5 cost 6th seal
maybe
With the full heal you can afford take damage playing the expensive 6th seal.
and you even have small heals with 1st seal too; plus 0 cost block cards.

seeing 60% of all possible cards in one makes it really easy to (for example) get 17 card reward seals with singing bowl
6th seal could use a rework, but I'm not sure what it could even do. The seals already cover all 5 resources you can obtain besides relics.
and something tells me that making 6th seal give you relics isnt a good idea ether
seeing 1 seal from 6th seal at a time is a good idea

you could even transform into another Sixth seal and double your transforms
anyways, this conversation was definitely about second seal
it'd be nice if second seal gave some kind of benefit that didn't have to wait to hit a shop to utilize
Yeah I think it's less of this seal being bad, but more of all of the other seals being way better
A potion is valued at like 50 gold in the shop
(cough cough "Singing Bowl" cough cough)

Second Seal does 2 main things on it's own. It lets you obtain extra gold for meta progression throughout the run to have stronger shops/events (getting a little better if you have the courier or membership card), and it can help trigger the bolstering ghostflame (while also working well with mummified hand, bird faced urn, and orange pellets). There are enough powers in hexaghosts card pool that I don't value the ghostflame interaction that highly, and the extra souls are not usually enough to justify the cost of including this in your deck without having membership card.

The cost, as with all the seals, is that they do basically nothing when you draw them, and help you out later in the run, whether through forming the broken seal or just their standard meta progression. This cost tends to be offset pretty well by afterlife, shield of night, and sword of night, all making it easier to afford to spend energy on the seals to get their rewards later. You are still down a card in your hand, so I recommend pairing the seals with extra card draw to smooth out your turns. Second seal is probably the worst of all of them, because it's benefit is the most delayed. I can use a potion in the next fight, an upgrade helps right now, better card rewards help improve quality, the healing keeps you topped off, but souls are useless until you find an opportunity to spend them. You can usually hedge with other seals and not fully commit (especially third, since it works on boss rewards), but I very rarely take second seal unless I am planning on going for all six.

Speaking of broken seal, yes it probably is a little too easy to pull off thanks to 3rd and 6th seals giving you lots of opportunities to find the others. It probably should be a more special thing, and It would also help make all of the seals more situational picks. The upgrade for all the seals is pretty bad, but that's by design, since you don't want to spend upgrades on "temporary" cards. The beta art is adorable.
I think the way I would "balance" the seals would be to nerf 5th seal to 3 cost, 4th seal to 2 cost, and 3rd seal to only give 2 options in the reward
Maybe but 2nd seal to like 12 souls
I do think that 2nd seal is probably a fine card, it's just being compared against all the other seals, which are all better than it
3rd seal could possibly be 1 option
7 hp is also a lot, especially considering hexa has multiple other incentives to take powers (broken seal, and bolstering ghostflame)
I think the seals should be noticeably worse than other cards with similar effects, since hexa just has so much support so it doesn't mind having them that much.

I would actually say that 3rd seal feels the most powerful, even more so than 6th. It's emulating the effect of prayer wheel (rare relic), but also works in both elite and boss combats (especially powerful in boss rewards, letting you simultaneously see two sets of 3 rares and choose what you want with full information). Seeing that many additional cards over the course of the run gives you so many opportunities to improve your deck and fine tune it for the challenges ahead. Part of the problem is also the synergy with ghost shield, a card which you will take every single copy of you can find. It should almost certainly cost 2 energy for that much power. I could also see limiting the number of cards you see at the reward screen.

Also worth noting that second seal looks pretty bad because it's natural to compare it to hand of greed. They are very different cards, but hand has that double functionality of being very solid burst damage on top of the gold scaling (and can even potentially trigger the extra gold multiple times in one fight). The upgrade also lets it scale even more gold, and makes it easier to land. Second seals only real upside is that you don't have to time it properly, but hand makes up for that by giving double the gold and being reusable in some fights.

I have found that taking literally just ghost shield and that is it for defense is not enough to survive act 3 bosses, and especially not act 4. You will need other block sources, and for act 4 you'll probably want gifts from beyond.
Hexa kinda sucks against Neow, due to the nature of how soulburn detonates and the invincible mechanic interacts, and due to the lack of sustain hexa can have if they don't have gifts from beyond.
I think that Hexa on average probably has the worst in-fight scaling of all the downfall characters, except maybe champ
